title: Are you worried about the corona virus outbreak had killed around 80 people and infected more than 2,100 others, including five in the U.S.? - Quora

response.answer_text: It is now 6:00 pm Thursday Evening Jan 30, 2020 Beijing Time Confirmed infections worldwide is 7783 with 170 deaths and 133 people fully recovered (takes 3 weeks to get this status and most cases are newer than 10 days) map courtesy of johnshopkins  I am not worried. In three months it has killed 162 people in a city of 11 million less than 100 people have been infected outside of China, which means they are doing a really good job containing it considering how much air traffic goes through China. The media started going on a rampage when there was less than 25 people dead. In the last 3 months of the flu season last year Cleveland, Ohio an American City of 385,000 people there were 174 deaths from flu related symptoms including pneumonia, no one bats an eye. These are the same sorts of people dying, mostly old people whose time was already limited due to age and other medical issues. Every month nearly 35,000 people die of Malaria in Africa. No one in America gives a shit. Thousands have died Puerto Rico because of Trump’s mismanagement and republicans say fuck them they can’t vote for the president, they don’t matter. However when 170 mostly old people in a country of 1.4 Billion die, Americans begin to lose their shit.

I am headed in the direction of worry. First, the death toll is about 3% so far. That's high. That's the approximate death percentage from the 1918 flu. Second, the incubation period is variable, ranging from a few days to two weeks. That means we could be in a major epidemic before we knew it. Attempts to stop it by quarantining Wuhan have failed. It's into the world at large. It could fizzle out quickly, as we all hope. But it could be 1918 all over again.

I live in Sacramento, California area. Of all the areas where the people coming back from China only a very few are coming into my area. For the people who have been diagnosed as being infected with the Corona virus, they are in government restricted areas. The Corona virus is respiratory so it can only be spread by coughing, sneezing or breathing within proximity. Because of this, I will not be exposed to it. I, therefore, have no worries about it.

A little bit but focus on protecting yourself…. avoid people who are visibly sick wash hands thoroughly and often dont touch your face or eyes or mouth without washing your hands first when in public try and be more than 3 feet away from people avoid public gatherings if you’re in a place where there is a high risk of outbreak. thats pretty much it
